title: High Gross Capital Formation
description: In 2022, Vanuatu's gross capital formation was 56.07% of GDP, indicating a strong investment in infrastructure and development projects.

title: Significant Gross Fixed Capital Formation
description: Vanuatu recorded a gross fixed capital formation of 55.45% of GDP in 2022, showcasing robust economic growth potential.

title: Strong Adjusted Net Savings
description: In 2020, Vanuatu's adjusted net savings, including particulate emission damage, stood at 37.98% of GNI, reflecting prudent economic management.

title: Low Tax Revenue from Income and Profits
description: In 2021, taxes on income, profits, and capital gains constituted only 0.23% of revenue, indicating a limited tax base.

title: Limited Public Services from Tax Administration
description: In 2024, Vanuatu scored 12.03 in the B-READY Taxation Pillar 2, highlighting challenges in public service provision by the tax administration.

title: Low Quality of Regulations for International Trade
description: Vanuatu's B-READY score for the quality of regulations for international trade was 44.87 in 2024, indicating room for improvement.

title: Inefficient Import and Export Processes
description: In 2024, Vanuatu scored 13.20 in the efficiency of importing and exporting goods, suggesting inefficiencies in trade processes.

title: Low Quality of Dispute Resolution Regulations
description: The quality of regulations for dispute resolution in Vanuatu was rated at 47.30 in 2024, indicating potential legal system challenges.

title: Negative Net Bilateral Aid from the UK
description: In 2022, Vanuatu experienced a net bilateral aid flow of -$60,000 from the UK, reflecting a decrease in financial support.

title: High Adjusted Net Savings Excluding Emission Damage
description: Vanuatu's adjusted net savings, excluding particulate emission damage, was 37.27% of GNI in 2021, indicating strong economic reserves.

title: Low Tax Contribution to Total Taxes
description: In 2021, taxes on income, profits, and capital gains accounted for only 0.63% of total taxes, suggesting a narrow tax base.
